entry.title: Presentation - Debugging with the Perl Debugger
entry.content:
This month, Brian Mielke will be giving a hands-on talk about the built-in Perl Debugger. The debugger allows you to pause execution of your code, run through it step by step, and examine variables and run arbitrary code while paused. The debugger is a great tool to use when dealing with unfamiliar code, and there's always a lot more of that than it appears.

RSVP on the Chicago.PM Meetup page

Slides are available on the talks page

Continue reading...

Tags: meeting

entry.title: Presentation - Introduction to Mojolicious
entry.content:
To start off the new year, Joel Berger will be giving an introduction to the Mojolicious web framework. The presentation itself is a Mojolicious app, hosted on Heroku.

RSVP for this meeting on the Chicago.PM Meetup page

The Chicago.PM is going mobile! If you're a business using Perl and would like to host one of the regular Chicago.PM meetings, or a special event, let Doug Bell know. More details on our Meetup discussion page.

Continue reading...

entry.title: Holiday Schedule - Office Hours 2
entry.content:
Due to the holiday schedule, our last meeting of the year will be Office Hours on December 11, starting at 6:30pm.

RSVP on the Chicago.PM Meetup to talk about Perl, code, and anything that comes up!

entry.title: Presentation - Modern Perl Object-Oriented Programming
entry.content:
This month's presentation will be on modern Perl OO and the tools to make object-oriented code easy.

Topics will include

  • Simple objects
  • Inheritance and roles
  • Method modifiers
  • Type checking and coercion
  • Meta classes

CPAN modules covered:

  • Moo
  • Role::Tiny
  • Type::Tiny
  • Moose

Doors open at 6:30pm. Meeting starts at 7:00pm. RSVP on the Chicago.PM Meetup

Continue reading...

Tags: meeting

entry.title: Meeting - Parsing - Regex and Grammars
entry.content:
This month, Doug Bell from Bank of America will be giving a talk on Parsing using plain regular expressions, the venerable Parse::RecDescent, and the modern Marpa::R2.

The examples given will be based on App::YAML::Filter, a mini-language like the jq document query language that allows filtering and creating YAML documents.

RSVP on the Chicago.PM Meetup page

Continue reading...
